meanings.definition: Remove (something) completely from existence or memory.
meanings.sent1: She erased all the mistakes on her paper before handing it in.
meanings.sent2: The teacher erased the whiteboard after the lesson was over.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally erased his important email while trying to organize his inbox.
meanings.sent4: The storm erased all signs of the sandcastle they had built on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick made it seem like he could erase objects with just a wave of his hand.

meanings.definition: Delete (data) from a computer storage device.
meanings.sent1: Remember to erase your browsing history for privacy.
meanings.sent2: The IT specialist erased the virus from the company's server.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally erased the entire document instead of just one paragraph.
meanings.sent4: The hacker tried to erase all evidence of their intrusion into the system.
meanings.sent5: The delete key on the keyboard can quickly erase mistakes while typing.

meanings.sent1: The flood erased the small town from the map.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire erased acres of forest in a matter of hours.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers could erase any threat to the city.
meanings.sent4: The dictator's regime tried to erase any opposition to their rule.
meanings.sent5: The eraser on the pencil can easily erase pencil marks on paper.
